description: The question content object has html display content to show the student, an answer key for offline grading, and metadata about the question. Html support is limited to <i>,<u>,<strong>,<em>,<b>, and <mark>. Question Content objects are fully self-contained, so all images must have inline data urls.

mcOptions.description: List of multiple choice answer options. This is required for all questions with the MC answer format.

categories.description: A question may belong to multiple category stacks.

group.description: List of all questions in the same group as this question. It may or may not include this question's id.

answerTimeSec.description: Max recommended time to answer this question.

deltaTimeSec.description: The 2 player game's add-time and subtract-time features would add or subtract this number of seconds from the clock.

PlainParagraphs.description: Actionable question, displayed with the answer input view. These paragraphs can contain images and math equations, like all other html fragments, and they're laid out in sequence, spaced out from each other, in the question view.

Narrative.description: This is a sequence of passages accompanying the question, and it's so large that it's displayed separately from the question instructions and answer input.

descriptionHtml.description: This describes the passages, and it's displayed with the passages as a header.

question.description: Actionable question, displayed with the instructions, near the answer input view.

DisplayReference.description: Use the question display from another question. You can use this to canonicalize the Narrative or Passage for a group of questions.

Passage.description: This is a text resource so large that it's displayed separately from the question instructions and answer input.  The instructions may reference a particular line in the passage, so each line is modeled separately, so that the view can ensure each line is labeled and distinguishable from all the other lines, on any form factor.

SATGridInAnswerKey.description: Limited form of student produced response, for some SAT math questions, corresponding to the SAT_GRIDIN answer format type. There may be more than one right answer to this kind of question.

StudentProducedResponseAnswerKey.description: Free form answer format corresponding to the SPR answer format type. There may be more than one right answer to this kind of question.

CategoryStacks.description: A question may belong under multiple different category hierarchies.

CategoryStack.description: This is interpreted as a hierarchical stack of category names. It informs the play2prep My Progress screen, where students can drill down into their achievement stats through levels of categories. The first name in the array is the top level category, and each subsequent item is a level nested under the preceeding item.

CategoryTheme.description: This theme determines the icon in the play2prep app, in the Daily Training schedule on the Home Screen and Daily Training Screen, and the Past Tests Screen.

NumericAnswerValueRange.description: Some sat grid-in answer can have any numeric value in a given range, that can be expressed as an inequality like '4.5 < x < 5.7' .

SATGridInAnswerValue.description: This represents a concrete, acceptable SAT grid-in answer value, like 4/3, 2.5, 1, etc.

CategoryName.description: This is a category display name students see in the play2prep app.  There's no 'id' symbology for categories, and all references to categories in the Content Publisher API are made with their full display names.

TimeSeconds.description: This model represents timings related to the time it takes to answer a question, in seconds.

HtmlFragment.description: Supports limited markup for italics, bold, underlining, and highlighting. All images must have inline data content urls, so that each question content object is fully self contained. This supports inline MathML, LaTeX, and ASCII Math.
